document.docAuthor: Larson, Helen K., Jaafar, Zeehan & Lim, Kelvin K. P.
document.masterDocTitle: An Annotated Checklist Of The Gobioid Fishes Of Singapore

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An Annotated Checklist Of The Gobioid Fishes Of Singapore

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius doriae Günther, 1868: 265
, Pl. 12, Fig. A ( Sarawak ); Larson 2001: 51 ( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: The CAS material reported by Larson (2001) may have been purchased, but not actually collected, in Singapore . The species is otherwise not known from Singapore .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

Brachygobius sua
–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

Brachygobius xanthomelas
–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ); Lim & Ng, 1990: 117 ( Singapore ; text refers to
B. kabiliensis
, figure is
B. xanthomelas
).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Sungei Tengeh, Sungei Berih, Sungei Poyan,
Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Sungei Kangkar, Mandai mangroves,
Sungei Simpang, Khatib Bongsu, Sungei Seletar, Pulau Seletar,
Sungei Punggol, Sungei Serangoon, Sungei Pinang , Loyang mangroves.

Calamiana illota Larson
Pseudogobius sp. 4
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ).
Calamiana illota Larson, 1999: 260–265
(Sungei Buloh mangroves,
Lim, 2005: 77 (Woodlands).
ZRC material from: Sungei Buloh, Woodlands, Mandai mangroves, Sungei Mandai, Khatib Bongsu, Loyang mangroves.

Mugilogobius polylepis Wu & Ni, 1985: 95–96
, Fig. 2 (Zhonggang, Fengxian, Shanghai ).

ZRC
material from: Pulau Tekong ( 1 ex. :
ZRC 47532
), Pasir Ris mangroves ( 2 ex. :
ZRC 50569
)
.
Remarks: New record for Singapore ( Fig. 2 ).

Apocryptes variegatus Peters, 1868: 267
( Singapore ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

in Herre & Myers, 1937: 41, Pl. 3 (Pulau Ubin), Koumans, 1940: 153 (Pulau Ubin); Koumans, 1953: 157 (Pulu Ubin);
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudogobius variegatus
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ).

(Sungei Buloh); Larson & Lim, 2005: 78 (Sungei Buloh).

Sungei Seletar, Seletar Dam, Pulau Seletar, Sungei Simpang, Khatib
Bongsu, Pasir Ris, Loyang mangroves.

; Karoli, 1882: 164 ( Singapore ).

Gnatholepis anjerensis
–
Fowler, 1938: 216
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: There is no recent material known from Singapore .

Fowler, 1938: 217
( Singapore ).

–

( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnatholepis cauerensis
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 259 ( Singapore ).
Remarks: There is no recent material known from Singapore .

Gobiopterus
cf
chuno
– Mok & Munro, 1991: 236 (in part; Sungei Buloh).
ZRC material from: Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Mandai mangroves,
Khatib Bongsu.
Remarks: The species of this genus are under investigation by Larson and Kottelat.

Gobiopterus
cf
chuno
– Mok & Munro, 1991: 236 (in part; Sungei Buloh).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobiopterus brachypterus

Anonymous, 2003: 94
(Sungei Buloh); Larson & Lim, 2005: 108 (Sungei Buloh).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4.
Cryptocentrus inexplicatus
(BPBM 21880 - 4.7 cm SL) from Pulau Salu, 29 Jul. 1977. Photgraph by J. E. Randall.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gobiopterus birtwistlei
(non–Herre) – Ng & Lim, 1996: 113 (Tengeh Reservoir, Lower Peirce Reservoir).
ZRC material from: Lower Peirce Reservoir, Tengeh Reservoir/
Sungei Tengeh, Sungei Buloh, Sungei Mandai, Sungei Simpang,
Khatib Bongsu, Pulau Seletar, Seletar Dam, Sungei Punggol, Sungei
Serangoon.
Remarks: The species of this genus are under investigation by Larson and Kottelat.

Mistichthys panayensis Herre, 1944: 108
( Capiz , Capiz Province , Panay, Philippines ).

ZRC
material from: Sungei Serangoon ( 1 ex. :
ZRC 47291
), Loyang mangroves ( 4 ex. :
ZRC 47672
)
.
Remarks: A new Singapore record.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius hoevenii Bleeker, 1851d: 426–427
(Sambas, in river, Borneo).

subSubSection.paragraph:
?
Pseudogobius hoevenii
– Murphy, 1990: 155 ( Singapore mangroves).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hemigobius hoeveni
–
Anonymous, 2003: 94
(Sungei Buloh).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Kallang basin, Sungei Pandan, Sungei Tengeh, Sungei Berih, Lim Chu Kang mangroves, Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Mandai mangroves, Sungei Sembawang, Sungei Simpang, Seletar Dam, Pulau Seletar, Sungei Punggol, Sungei Serangoon, Pasir Ris, Loyang mangroves, Pulau Ubin.

Remarks: Most records of
Stigmatogobius hoevenii
from Singapore refer to
Mugilogobius chulae
; the name has been misapplied in many localities.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gnatholepis mingi Herre, 1936a: 8–9
, Pl. IV (Pulau Ubin); Herre & Myers, 1937: 40 (Pulau Ubin);
Fowler, 1938: 266
(Pulan Ubin).

Stigmatogobius mingi
– Koumans, 1953: 118–119 (Pulu Ubin);
Chua, 1973: 526
(Ponggol Estuary).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hemigobius melanurus
– Ng & Sivasothi, 1999: 136–137 ( Singapore ).
ZRC material from: Sungei Pandan, Sungei Berih, Lim Chu Kang mangroves, Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Mandai mangroves, Sungei Sembawang, Sungei Punggol, Sungei Serangoon, Loyang mangroves.

Vaimosa chulae Smith, 1932: 260
, Pl. 23 (Koh Samui, Gulf of Thailand ).

Stigmatogobius hoeveni
(non–Bleeker) – Tweedie, 1936: 28 (Geylang, Ayer Merbau Island).

?
Pseudogobius hoevenii
(non–Bleeker) – Murphy, 1990: 155 ( Singapore mangroves).
ZRC material from: Geylang, Pulau Ayer Merbau, West Coast Park,

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 5.
Cryptocentrus strigilliceps
at Pulau Hantu. Photograph by Jani Thuaibah.

subSubSection.paragraph: Sungei Berih, Sungei Buloh, Mandai mangroves, Sungei Sembawang, Pulau Seletar, Punggol, Sungei Serangoon, Loyang mangroves.

Remarks: A name used earlier for this species,
Stigmatogobius hoevenii
, has been often confused with
Hemigobius hoevenii
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Mugilogobius fasciatus Larson
Mugilogobius sp.
12 – Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ).
Mugilogobius fasciatus Larson, 2001: 116–119
(Sungei Buloh mangroves, Singapore );
Anonymous, 2003: 94
(Sungei Buloh);

subSubSection.paragraph: Larson & Lim, 2005: 118 (Sungei Buloh). ZRC material from: Sungei Buloh.

Gobius mertoni Weber, 1911: 37
, Figs. 5–6 (Panua Bori River near Sungei Manumbai, Aru Island).

Mugilogobius mertoni
– Larson, 2001: 144 (Sungei Pandan); Larson & Lim, 2005: 119 (Sungei Pandan).
ZRC material from: Pulau Semakau, Sungei Pandan.

Remarks: The specimens identified as
Mugilogobius sp.
29 in Lim

& Larson (1994) appear to be
M. mertoni
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius platystoma Günther, 1872: 664
, Pl. 63, Fig. B (Port Mackay, Queensland , Australia ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mugilogobius platystomus
– Larson, 2001: 165 (Serangoon).
Remarks: No recent material of this species observed in Singapore .

Mugilogobius rambaiae (Smith)
Vaimosa rambaiae Smith, 1945: 538
, Pl. 9a ( Bangkok , Thailand ).
Mugilogobius rambaiae
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore );
Larson, 2001: 170 (Serangoon, tidal stream near Woodlands,
& Lim, 2005: 120 (Woodlands). ZRC material from: Sungei Buloh, Woodlands, Sungei Serangoon.

Mugilogobius sp.
12A – Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ).

Mugilogobius tigrinus Larson, 2001: 189–192
(Sungei Pandan, Singapore ); Larson & Lim, 2005: 121 (Loyang mangroves).
ZRC material from: Sungei Pandan, Loyang mangroves.

Gobius acutipennis Valenciennes, 1837: 80
(Malabar, India ).

Aparrius acutipinnis
– Herre & Myers, 1937: 45 ( Singapore ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Oligolepis melanostigma
–
Fowler, 1938: 218–219
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: There is no recent material of this genus known from Singapore . The genus is in need of revision, and the currently used species name may not be correct for the Indo–Malaysian population of this fish.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Oxyurichthus auchenolepis
–
Fowler, 1938: 219
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: No recent specimens known from Singapore .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius microlepis Bleeker, 1849: 35
(Freto Madurae prope Surabaya et Sumanap).

Oxyurichthus microlepis
–
Fowler, 1938: 219
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Johor Straits off Yishun.

Gobius papuensis Valenciennes, 1837: 106
(New Guinea ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Oxyurichthus belosso
–
Fowler, 1938: 219
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: No recent material of this species known from Singapore .

Gobius (Oxyurichthys) uronema Weber, 1909: 153
(Bay of Bima, Sumbawa, Indonesia ).

Oxyurichthys uronema
– Larson & Lim, 2005: 124 ( Singapore ). ZRC material from: Bedok, Singapore River, Punggol.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pandaka cf. pygmaea
Herre
Pandaka pygmaea Herre, 1927: 198
, Pl. 15, Fig. 3 ( Philippines );

subSubSection.paragraph:
(Sungei Buloh); Larson & Lim, 2005: 126 (Loyang mangroves).
Pandaka trimaculata
– Anonymous, 2003: 94 (Sungei Buloh). ZRC material from: Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Sungei Simpang, Pulau Seletar, Loyang mangroves. Remarks: The genus
Pandaka
is presently under revision by Larson.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobiopsis oligactis Bleeker, 1875b: 113–114
(Amboina, Indonesia ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudogobiopsis oligactis
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 (Central Catchment streams); Ng & Lim, 1996: 113 (Central Catchment area); Larson & Lim, 2005: 143 ( Singapore ).
ZRC material from: MacRitchie Reservoir, Sungei Kallang outlet from MacRitchie Reservoir.
Remarks: This species appears to have become extinct in Singapore ,
with the only known specimens having been collected in 1959.

Despite recent surveys of most habitats on the island by resident biologists,
P. oligactis
has not been found since. Munro’s (1990)

diagrammatic Fig. 5 shows a species of
Pseudogobiopsis
; however,

his discussion could also refer to
Rhinogobius giurinus
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Vaimosa siamensis Fowler, 1934: 157
, Fig. 125 (Silom Canal, Bangkok , Thailand ).

Vaimosa jurongensis Herre, 1940a: 18
, Pl. 13 (Jurong, Singapore ); Koumans, 1953: 386–387 ( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Vaimosa singapurensis
– Tweedie, 1940: 75 (Jurong).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
“ Vaimosa ” jurongensis
–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudogobiopsis siamensis
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ); Ng & Lim, 1996: 113 (Sungei Seletar); Larson & Lim, 2005: 144 (outlet of MacRitchie Reservoir).
ZRC material from: Sungei Kallang outlet from MacRitchie Reservoir, Sungei Seletar.

Remarks: Tweedie (1940) refers to paratypes of
Vaimosa singapurensis Herre
lodged in the Raffles Museum. This was possibly a museum name for
Vaimosa jurongensis Herre. The
species was thought to be locally extinct (see Ng & Lim, 1996: 113) until three specimens ( ZRC 50271 ) were collected in March 2005 .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Vaimosa avicennia Herre, 1940a: 17
, Pl.12 (mangrove swamp, Kranji River, Singapore ); Koumans, 1953: 386 ( Singapore ).

“ Vaimosa ” avicennia
–
Gomez 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Siglap canal, Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Sungei
Sembawang, Pulau Seletar, Loyang mangroves.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius javanicus Bleeker, 1856: 88
(Patjitan, central Java ).

Vaimosa piapensis Herre, 1927: 147
, Pl. 10, Fig. 3 (Piapi Creek, Dumaguete, Oriental Negros, Philippines ); Herre & Myers, 1937: 40 (reefs at Singapore & Pulau Ubin); Tweedie, 1940: 75 (Kranji).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Cryptocentrus
new species 1 from Pulau Salu, 11 Aug.1977, BPBM 22048: a, 5.2 cm SL; b, 4.8 cm SL. Photograph by J. E. Randall.

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Kallang basin, West Coast Park, Sungei Pandan,
Sungei Tuas, Pulau Buloh, Sungei Buloh, Mandai mangroves,
Sungei Simpang, Khatib Bongsu, Seletar Dam, Pulau Seletar, Seletar
Wet Gap, Pasir Ris beach, Loyang mangroves, Pulau Ubin.

Remarks: This is a widespread species being revised by Larson (in prep.). There may be another species confused with
P. javanicus
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius melanosticta Day, 1876: 290
, Pl. 63, Fig. 2 (Madras, India ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Vaimosa serangoonensis Herre
in Herre & Myers, 1937: 40, Pl. 2 (creek at Serangoon, Singapore ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius poicilostoma
–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudogobius melanostictus
– Larson & Lim, 2005: 142 (Mandai mangroves).
ZRC material from: West Coast Park, Mandai mangroves, Sungei
Serangoon.
Remarks: This species is being revised by Larson (in prep.).

Pseudogobius melanostictus
may not be the correct name to apply to the Singapore population.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius isognathus Bleeker, 1878: 203
( Singapore );
Fowler, 1938: 221
( Singapore ); Koumans, 1953: 115–116 ( Singapore ).?
Stigmatogobius römeri
– Koumans, 1953: 113–114 ( Singapore ).
Stigmatogobius romeri
–
Gomez, 1980: 95
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Sungei Buloh, Sungei Simpang, Khatib Bongsu, Pulau Seletar, Pulau Ubin.

Remarks: The genus
Redigobius
is under investigation by Larson (in prep.), and
R. isognathus
may not be the correct name to apply to the Singapore species.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius singapurensis Bleeker, 1878: 204
( Singapore ) –
Fowler, 1938: 221
( Singapore ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
?
Stigmatogobius römeri
– Koumans, 1953: 113–115 ( Singapore ).
Remarks: No recent material of this species is known from
Singapore .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius pleurostigma Bleeker, 1849: 28–29
(Surabaya, Java ).

Stigmatogobius pleurostigma
– Lim & Larson 1994: 261 ( Singapore );
Anonymous 2003: 95
(Sungei Buloh); Larson & Lim, 2005: 150 (Pandan mangroves); Larson, 2005: 358, Fig. 7 (Sungei Pandan mangroves).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Sungei Kallang, Sungei Pandan, Sungei Buloh,
Pulau Ubin.
Remarks: This species may occur syntopically with the next species.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius sandanundio
[sic] –
Anonymous, 2003: 95
(Sungei Buloh).

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Pulau Hantu, Sungei Pandan, Pulau Buloh,
Sungei Buloh, Sungei Sembawang, Sungei Simpang, Pulau Seletar,
Sungei Punggol, Pasir Ris, Pulau Ubin.
Remarks: This species may be syntopic with the previous species,
and may be more common in Singapore .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius sella (Steindachner)
Gobius sella Steindachner, 1881: 212 (Borneo)
.
Vaimosa brocki Herre, 1936a: 9
( Singapore Harbour); Herre &

subSubSection.paragraph: Myers, 1937: 40 ( Singapore reef); Fowler, 1938: 267 (reef in
Singapore Harbour).

Gobius giurinus Rutter, 1897: 86
(Swatow, China ).

Stigmatogobius poicilosoma
(non–Bleeker) – Lim & Ng, 1989: 115 ( Singapore ).

Rhinogobius
cf
giurinus
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 261 ( Singapore ); Ng & Lim, 1996: 117 (Central Catchment, Botanic Gardens, Jurong Road).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stigmatogobius poecilosoma
(non-Bleeker) –
Anonymous, 2003: 95
(Sungei Buloh).

Redigobius giurinus
–
Anonymous, 2003: 94
(Sungei Buloh).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rhinogobius giurinus
– Larson & Lim, 2005: 146 (Upper Seletar).
ZRC material from: Lower Peirce Reservoir, Botanic Gardens,
Tengeh Reservoir, Sungei Buloh, Upper Seletar Reservoir, Mandai
Road at Mandai Lake Road junction, Lorong Banir.
Remarks: This introduced species from East Asia may be partly responsible for the decline and apparent disappearance of

Pseudogobiopsis species
in Singapore .

Fig. 7.
Cryptocentrus
new species 2 at Pulau Hantu. Photograph by Jani Thuaibah.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gobius borneensis Bleeker, 1851a: 10 (Banjermassing, Borneo)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Stigmatogobius sella
– Larson & Lim, 2005: 152; Larson, 2005: 363 ( Singapore harbour).
Remarks: No recent material of this species is known from
Singapore .
